review: To start off, I want tosay that I hav enot had cable in over 5 years, and with devices such as these, I will never go back. This is my first Roku, previously I was using my Xbox 360 to stream Netflix, Hulu, and the others.  I decided I did not want to pay the $10.65/month to have Xbox anymore and bounght this instead.  I have several friends that have one and they all agreed that this was the way to go, especially if you don't do any gaming. Which I don't.Packaging is simple and clever, and easy to navigate. Setup was a bit of a chore, I recommend you have your laptop up and running in front of you, along with all of the usernames and passwords of your various accounts.  The Roku is going to send you a confirmation code that you are going to need to enter in to a page on their site, i think it was www.roku.com/register.  This was also the case with HBO Go, Showtime, and a few others.  They do this to register the devise.  After reading several reviews, expecially that parts about the setup, I agree that it takes a little while, but this is completely dependent on how many services you have and how many you want.The remote feels well made, and i do like the hot keys on the bottom, though I am a little confused how Blockbuster made it to the list to be added with a special button.  The navigation can be slow some times, but that is only if you are zipping along, backing out of bages, and generally treating the device like a quad core PC.  It's a small, streaming stick and is not going to perform like a DVR Box.  I think that is where people are getting frustrated and overall shaming the device for. I did not fault it for doing what it is supposed to do at the capacity at which it was made.This is a great devise, I recommend it to anyone thinking of cutting cable.  I have my antenna hooked up to for loacl TV, so with that I cannot see spending over $150 a month ever again for cable.

So I give it a three star rating because of that.
